qas.question: Who thought that the seasonal drift in the date of Easter unacceptable?
What even is tired to the date for Easter?
What did the Church of Alexandria use to calculate the date of Easter?
Where did the Church of Alexandria place the vernal equinox?
Until 342 when did the Church of Rome think the vernal equinox fell?
Who found the drifting and the date of the spring equinox unacceptable?

plausible_answers.text: the Sunday after the 14th day of the moon

qas.question: What did the church of Rome use the metonic cycle to determine?
What did the church of Alexandria place on March 25?
What did the Church of Rome place on 21 March

context: Because the <a1_0><b8_0>spring equinox<b8_0/><a1_0/> was tied to the date of Easter, the <a0_0><b5_0>Roman Catholic Church<b5_0/><a0_0/> considered the seasonal drift in the date of Easter undesirable. The Church of Alexandria celebrated Easter on <b6_0>the Sunday after the 14th day of the moon<b6_0/> (computed using the <a2_0>Metonic cycle<a2_0/>) that falls on or after the <b7_0>vernal equinox<b7_0/>, which they placed on <a3_0>21 March<a3_0/>. However, the Church of Rome still regarded <a4_0>25 March<a4_0/> as the equinox (until 342) and used a different cycle to compute the day of the moon. In the Alexandrian system, since the 14th day of the Easter moon could fall at earliest on 21 March its first day could fall no earlier than 8 March and no later than 5 April. This meant that Easter varied between 22 March and 25 April. In Rome, Easter was not allowed to fall later than 21 April, that being the day of the Parilia or birthday of Rome and a pagan festival.The first day of the Easter moon could fall no earlier than 5 March and no later than 2 April.
